Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL DRILLING PERIOD OBSERVATION NUMBER: unique identifier for areporting period for well operations. Internationally, there may be 1, 2 or 3 periodseach 24 hours. In some jurisdictions, reporting may occur for more than one period,such as for an 8 hour tour shift and a 24 daily summary.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: BOTTOM HOLE ASSEMBLY WEIGHT: the total weight on the bottom hole assemblyat PERIOD REPORT TIME.
Column Comment.5: BOILER FUEL: Measurement of fuel remaining in tank at PERIOD REPORT TIME.Can be recorded in liters or meters of height in tank
Column Comment.7: CAMP INDICATOR: A Y / N flag indicating whether the crew is camped on-site. Thedetermines which specific financial obligations for living arrangements are incurred.
Column Comment.8: MAXIMUM ALLOWABLE CASING PRESSURE: maximum pressure which can beheld at surface in a kick situation. Depends on drilling fluid density, depth of casingshoe, casing burst pressures and surface equipment limitations.
Column Comment.9: CASING PRESS MAX ALLOWABLE OUOM: Unit of Measure used to measurecasing pressure. Current CAODC standard is kPa (kilopascals).
Column Comment.10: CIRCULATING PRESSURE: The circulating pressure recorded at the PERIODREPORT TIME for the period, usually start or end of the period.
Column Comment.11: CIRCULATING PRESSURE MAXIMUM: The maximum circulating pressure recordedduring this period.
Column Comment.13: CIRCULATING PRESSURE MINIMUM: The minimum circulating pressure recordedduring this period.
Column Comment.16: CIRCULATING PRESSURE TYPE: Indicates whether one or both pumps were onthe hole, such as Single, Combined, Parallel
Column Comment.17: CONTRACTOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thebusiness associate who is the contractor for this drilling report.
Column Comment.18: CONTRACTOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE REPRESENTATIVE IDENTIFIER: Uniqueidentifier for the business associate who represents the contractor for this drillingreport. You can store this information as a validated foreign key in this column or assimple text in CONTRACTOR REP NAME.
Column Comment.19: CONTRACTOR REPRESENTATIVE NAME: the name of the representative for thecontractor in plain text. To store this information as a valid business associate, useCONTRACTOR REP BA ID.
Column Comment.20: CONTRACTOR REPRESENTATIVE SIGNED IND: A Y/N flag indicating that thecontractor representative has signed the original version of the drilling report.
Column Comment.21: CUMULATIVE CREW SAFETY DAYS: the cumulative number of safety days for thiscrew.
Column Comment.22: CUMULATIVE RIG SAFETY DAYS: the cumulative number of safety days (accidentfree) for the rig.
Column Comment.23: DRILL ACTIVITY SET: The activity set associated with a drilling activity type.
Column Comment.24: DRILL ACTIVITY TYPE: The primary type of drilling activity during a tour. Could bedrilling, coring, reaming, etc...
Column Comment.25: DRILL PIPE SINGLE COUNT: the number of single joints of drill pipe remaining afterthe stands of pipe have been counted. Recorded at the PERIOD REPORT TIME,usually the start or end of the period.
Column Comment.26: DRILL PIPE SINGLE LENGTH: the length of the single joints of pipe. Recorded atthe PERIOD REPORT TIME, usually the start or end of the period.
Column Comment.28: DRILL PIPE STAND COUNT: The number of stands of drill pipe in the drill string.Recorded at the PERIOD REPORT TIME, usually the start or end of the period.
Column Comment.29: DRILL PIPE STAND LENGTH: the length of the total stands of drill pipe in the drillstring. Recorded at the PERIOD REPORT TIME, usually the start or end of theperiod.
Column Comment.31: DRILL STRING TORQUE: the amount of torque required to turn the drill string in thehole. Recorded at the PERIOD REPORT TIME, usually the start or end of the period.
Column Comment.33: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.34: END DATE: the date that the well drill period ends. While it is usually possible tocapture date, time and timezone in a single complex data type (Oracle Timestamp),this information is divided into three separate components for this table.
Column Comment.35: END TIME: The time of day when this well drilling period ended.
Column Comment.36: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.37: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.38: FINANCE IDENTIFIER: This foreign key column can be used to store a link to afinance system. The column may be a surrogate value, in which case theFINANCE.REFERENCE_NUMBER will contain the AFE number, or the ID maycontain the AFE number. You can use the FINANCE table to connect to yourfinancial systems.
Column Comment.39: HOLE DRAG: Measured on the trip out. The Force required to pull the drill string inexcess of the string weight.
Column Comment.40: HOLE DRAG UNIT OF MEASURE: The unit of measure used for hole drag. Thecurrent CAODC standard is 1000 daN (thousands of decaNeutons).
Column Comment.41: HOLE FILL LENGTH: Hole fill is material that has sloughed in, or settled to thebottom of the hole while the drill string has been off bottom. Measured from bottom.
Column Comment.42: HOLE FILL LENGTH ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original Unit of Measure usedfor Hole Fill on Bottom. Current CAODC standard is m (meters).
Column Comment.43: HOOKLOAD MAXIMUM: Maximum hookload experienced during tour while hoistingor working string.
Column Comment.44: HOOKLOAD MAX OUOM: Original Unit of Measure used to measure MaximumHookload. For current CAODC standard, should be 1000 daN, for thousands ofdecaNewtons.
Column Comment.45: CONTRACTOR JOB NUMBER: The job number or code assigned to this job by thecontractor.
Column Comment.46: FROM KELLY BUSHING DOWN LENGTH: Length of kelly below the kelly bushingmeasuring point - required to calculate Total Depth.
Column Comment.48: MUD SYSTEM TYPE: To describe the specific mud system being used (i.e. Invert,Gel-Chemical, Gel-Polymer etc.).
Column Comment.49: MUD TYPE OIL INDICATOR: A Y/N column indicating whether the mud system is oilbased. If not oil based, should be water based. If this flag is Y, then the MUD TYPEWATER IND must be N.
Column Comment.50: MUD TYPE WATER IND: A Y/N flag indicating that the mud type used is waterbased. If this flag is Y, then the MUD TYPE OIL IND must be N.
Column Comment.51: OPERATOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for thebusiness associate that is operator for this well on this drill period. Explorationcompany name. Required if the rig is contracted and actively working. Usually, thiswill be the same as WELL.OPERATOR, and should be compared. For variousreasons, it is possible for the operator to change over the drilling cycle, but this is notcommon.
Column Comment.52: OPERATOR FUEL: Fuel consumed by Operators equipment during the periodcovered by the drill period.
Column Comment.55: OPERATOR REPRESENTATIVE BA ID: Unique identifier for the business associatewho represents the operator for this drilling period. If an unvalidated name ispreferred, use the column OPERATOR REP NAME.
Column Comment.56: OPERATOR REPRESENTATIVE NAME: An unvalidated name for the operatingcompany representative during this period. If a validated name is preferred, useOPERATOR REP BA ID.
Column Comment.57: OPERATOR REPRESENTATIVE SIGNED IND: A Y/N flag indicating whether therepresentative for the operator has signed the operations report for this period.
Column Comment.58: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.59: PRIMARY ACTIVITY INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this activity was theprimary activity that operations were engaged in.
Column Comment.60: RATE SCHEDULE IDENTIFIER: For the CAODC, this is a check box on form, usedto indicate rate schedule. Choice of: REGULAR, REPAIR, INVERT. Details of therate schedule may be captured in the RATE SCHEDULE tables.
Column Comment.61: RE-ENTRY INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this operation is a wellre-entry (Y) or not (N).
Column Comment.62: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.63: REPORTED BASE LOCATION: Location as recorded on well license. Location couldalso be rack site or yard as appropriate. This location should be compared to theauthorized well location and discrepancies investigated.
Column Comment.64: REPORTED KELLY BUSING ELEVATION: The reported kelly bushing elevation forthe well.
Column Comment.66: REPORTED LICENSE NUMBER: License number issued by the governing agencyfor each jurisdiction as reported.
Column Comment.67: REPORTED PERIOD NUMBER: Use this column to capture the reported periodnumber, which is often only unique within a report, so cannot be used as a uniqueidentifier.
Column Comment.68: REPORTED WELL PROFILE TYPE: The type of profile reported for this well, suchas vertical, horizontal and directional.
Column Comment.69: REPORTED RIG NAME: The name of the rig as reported.
Column Comment.70: REPORTED RIG RELEASE DATE: The rig release date as reported by thecontractor.
Column Comment.71: REPORTED RIG RELEASE TIME: The time of day when the rig release wasreported as released.
Column Comment.72: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.73: REPORTED SPUD DATE: the spud date as reported for this well.
Column Comment.74: REPORTED SPUD TIME: The reported time of day that the well was spudded.
Column Comment.75: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.76: REPORTED LOCATION: Location as recorded on well license. Location could alsobe rack site or yard as appropriate. This location should be compared to theauthorized well location and discrepancies investigated.
Column Comment.77: REPORTED UWI: the Unique well identifier assigned to the well as reported by thedrilling operations. Note that this may not correspond with the authorized UWI, but itis often important to keep this information intact as reported for regulatory reasons.
Column Comment.78: REPORTED WELL NAME: The name of the well as captured in this report. This maynot correspond with the formal name of the well, but should be kept for regulatoryreporting requirements. As assigned by the governing agency. Usually Operatorname, strike area and location.
Column Comment.79: PERIOD REPORT TIME TYPE: The point in the well drilling period at which reportsare made. Usually either the START or END of the period.
Column Comment.80: RIG FUEL: Measurement of fuel remaining in tank the REPORT TIME TYPE (start orend of shift). Can be recorded in liters or meters of height in tank.
Column Comment.81: RIG FUEL ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: could be linear or volumetric, dependingon how fuel amounts are measured.
Column Comment.83: SAFETY MEETING TOPIC: the subject(s) of the safety meeting held during thisperiod. Enter NONE if no safety meeting was held.
Column Comment.84: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.85: START DATE: The date that this well drill period commenced. While it is usuallypossible to capture date, time and timezone in a single complex data type (OracleTimestamp), this information is divided into three separate components for this table.
Column Comment.86: START TIME: The time of day that this period began.
Column Comment.87: TIMEZONE: a valid list of time zones. You can obtain a list of timezones fromwww.worldtimezone.com.
Column Comment.88: TOTAL DRILL TOOL LENGTH: Calculated Field. The total length of all drilling tools:Bottom Hole Assembly, Drill Pipe Singles and Stands, plus Kelly Down.
Column Comment.89: TOTAL DRILL TOOL LENGTH OUOM: Unit of Measure used for all preceding lengthfields. For current CAODC standard, should be m, for meter.
Column Comment.90: TOTAL DRILL TOOL WEIGHT: Weight (measurement of force) of the entire drillstring at the time REPORT TIME TYPE.
Column Comment.92: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.93: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.94: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.95: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.96: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.97: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.98: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
